item.title: My Reflections on the 2019 RSA Conference
item.description: Reflecting on my existential crisis during RSAC, I tried to distill what exactly was so troublesome about the conference. The expo floor was less two separate halls, as per years prior, and more like Mordor, with a befouled sprawl connecting Minas Morgul and the Black Gate — but instead of orcs and Uruk-hai, vendors crammed the hallways that used to serve as open breathing space. The RSAC Innovation Sandbox’s “natural” lighting (featuring me and my buzzword bingo card) The color of RSAC itself is royal purple — fitting as hosts of this ostentatious banquet — with a splash of cyber-turquoise.
